title: customers made with data
short-description: Millesima is discovering the right wine for any occasion with data

assets.copy: Millesima is discovering the right wine for any occasion with data
assets.capability: How to provide one-to-one services

assets.title: Summary
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about IBM Big Data & Analytics
assets.copy:
The Bordeaux-based fine wine retailer Millesima was looking for a way to expand their business globally, while continuing to offer a superior, individualized customer experience.

By leveraging IBM Big Data & Analytics, they’re now able to customize their marketing and their website to serve the right content to the right client based on, for instance, geography and purchase history. This means they can offer more personalized customer service while continuing to grow.

assets.quote: Now, because we’re using data, we try to bring the right wine to the right person, according to taste.
assets.attribution:
Gerard Spatafora
E-Commerce Manager, Millesima

templates.template_desc: Get to know the people and the solutions behind the transformation.

assets.title: IBM Big Data & Analytics—Marketing and Sales
assets.copy: IBM Business Analytics solutions for marketing can help organizations acquire, grow and retain customers by anticipating their desires and creating personalized experiences. By identifying customer attitudes, opinions and emerging trends, marketers can better develop effective marketing strategies for the future.

assets.title: IBM WebSphere Commerce Enterprise
assets.copy: IBM WebSphere® Commerce Enterprise is a cross-channel e-commerce platform with integrated order management, analytics and marketing tools. It facilitates high-volume business-to-consumer and business-to-business sales using multiple channels.

assets.title:
Arnaud Naccache
Managing Director & Partner, AlizNet
assets.copy: Arnaud Naccache co-founded Netik (acquired by AlizNet), one of the most experienced and knowledgeable eCommerce agencies in the French retail market, in 2004. He has served as consultant at WPP in Paris and acted as sales director of Ogilvy Interactive.

assets.title:
Pascale Grabowski
Smarter Commerce Sales Leader, IBM France
assets.copy: Since joining IBM, Pascale Grabowski has worked in various roles in relationship and business development, helping clients understand their markets and customers to implement Smarter Commerce solutions.

title: skis made with data
short-description: Blizzard Ski is predicting ski demand with data

assets.copy: Blizzard Ski is predicting ski demand with data
assets.capability: How to predict demand

assets.title: Summary
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about IBM Big Data & Analytics
assets.copy:
Every year, Blizzard Ski manufactures roughly 400,000 skis, some requiring as many as 18 different materials and taking up to 16 weeks to build. Using data, they’ve started forecasting ski trends, weather patterns, and other short-term shifts in the market that affect their business, and can now quickly respond to changing demands in specific ski towns.

Data has also given them the ability to monitor their supplies so that no matter how demands change, they can have the materials to meet them. Since becoming data-driven, production cycles have been reduced to 8 weeks, making Blizzard skis more nimble than ever.

assets.quote: With real-time data, we can produce what the market needs, when it needs them. A few years ago that wasn’t possible.
assets.attribution:
Eric-Jan Kaak
CIO, Blizzard Ski

assets.quote: IBM is also helping us look at how weather patterns influence ski demand.
assets.attribution:
Eric-Jan Kaak
CIO, Blizzard Ski

assets.copy: more accurate at predicting demand for skis
less idle time on the production line

templates.template_desc: Get to know the people and the solutions behind the transformation.

assets.title: IBM Cognos Business Intelligence
assets.copy: IBM Cognos<sup>®</sup> Business Intelligence provides reporting, analysis and dashboards to help key stakeholders understand business performance, collaborate, and make data-driven decisions.

assets.title: IBM Big Data - Operations Analysis
assets.copy: Operations Analysis focuses on analyzing machine data, which can include anything from IT machines to sensors, meters and GPS devices. By using big data for operations analysis, an organization can improve its operations by gaining real-time visibility into customer experience, transactions and behavior.

assets.title:
Armin Hofer
Mid-Market Territory Representative, IBM
assets.copy: Armin Hofer joined IBM in 2009 as Inside Sales Representative for the ITS Services Business. In 2010, he moved to a client-facing role as Mid-Market Client Representative and works to bring the best business solutions to a variety of industries and clients.

title: rugby made with data
short-description: The WARATAH'S RUGBY team is predicting player injuries with data

assets.copy: The WARATAH'S RUGBY team is predicting player injuries with data
assets.capability: How to find Big Data insights

assets.title: Summary
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about WARATAH’S RUGBY
assets.copy:
When it came to predicting player injuries, the Waratah’s rugby team of New South Wales, Australia used to have to guess. But when IBM shared with them a model that helped them predict injuries with greater accuracy, analytics proved to be a gamechanger.

Now the Waratah’s analyze data collected from several sources (like accelerometers players wear that measure intensity levels, collisions and fatigue) to anticipate and avoid injuries, and also to come up with specific regimens to better train individual players. Injuries were once an unavoidable reality of sports; now data-driven teams can prevent them for a competitive advantage.

assets.quote: We used to use our coaching intuition to predict injuries. Now we use predictive analytics.
assets.attribution:
Hayden Masters
Athletic Development Manager, WARATAH’S RUGBY

assets.quote: Our players are our #1 assets. If we don't manage our assets, then our business — winning football games — will suffer.
assets.attribution:
Hayden Masters
Athletic Development Manager, WARATAH’S RUGBY

templates.template_desc: Get to know the people and the solutions behind the transformation.

assets.title: SPSS Software
assets.copy: SPSS predictive analytics software helps organizations to predict what will happen next so they can make smarter decisions to improve business outcomes.

assets.title: IBM Big Data & Analytics - Predictive Analytics
assets.copy: IBM Predictive Analytics helps organizations predict what will happen next and helps them make smarter decisions. With predictive analytics, clients can manage physical and virtual assets, maintain their infrastructure and increase the efficiency of their people, making it easier to improve business outcomes.

assets.title:
Angelica Veness
Business Analytics Solutions Architect, IBM
assets.copy: Angelica Veness has been working in the analytics industry for over 10 years. Angelica specializes in helping companies to ‘predict and act’ rather than ‘sense and react’, with a personal interest in increasing the use of analytics in sports to optimise performance and minimise injury.

title: tennis made with cloud
short-description: Wimbledon is engaging fans like never before with cloud

assets.copy: Wimbledon is engaging fans like never before with cloud
assets.capability: How to innovate a business model

assets.title: Summary
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about Wimbledon
assets.copy:
Wimbledon is more than a sporting event, it’s a global cultural and social experience. Now, thanks to IBM solutions like cloud and Big Data & Analytics, the club can engage its audiences with new, innovative touchpoints.

The organization uses IBM Cloud to help predict increases in the number of spectators, allowing it to adjust IT resource allocation on the fly. The innovative solution even looks at what is trending on Twitter to predict spikes in resource demand so that Wimbledon fans never miss any of the action.

assets.quote: Five or ten years ago, you didn't get to see Wimbledon unless you were sitting in front of a TV. Now people can access us anytime, anywhere, through different platforms and devices.
assets.attribution:
Mick Desmond
Commercial Director, The All England Lawn Tennis Club

assets.quote: Fans don’t want to just see what’s happening, they want to know and understand why it’s happening.
assets.attribution:
Mick Desmond
Commercial Director, The All England Lawn Tennis Club

assets.copy: Downloads of the Wimbledon app developed by IBM
Unique users on Wimbledon.com last year
of views to the site were from mobile devices

assets.copy: IBM Cloud is a collection of enterprise-class technology-as-a-service to help customers develop cloud and mobile applications on a leading-edge platform. By using self-service infrastructure with instant deployment, it offers agility and innovative applications to business users.

assets.title:
Sam Seddon
Wimbledon and RFU Client & Program Executive, IBM
assets.copy: Sam Seddon is the IBM Wimbledon Client and Program Executive. He is responsible for managing the end-to-end delivery of technical solutions to the championship, as part of IBM's role as the official IT provider to the AELTC.

title: birdies made with cloud
short-description: TruGolf is making golf more accessible with cloud

assets.copy: TruGolf is making golf more accessible with cloud
assets.capability: How to innovate a business model

assets.title: Summary
assets.copy:
TruGolf is a platform that allows players to compete against each other in virtual tournaments by simulating the locations of over 85 world-renowned golf courses.

With IBM Cloud, TruGolf provides precise-analytics, 36 modes of play and realistic graphics, so golf players of any level can enjoy the game and practice with each other. Golf is now more accessible and available than ever before.
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about IBM Cloud - IaaS

assets.quote: You're going to see golf become more family friendly. It's going to be more accessible. It really is going to change the sport and make it more relatable to younger people.
assets.attribution:
Chris Jones
CEO, TruGolf, Inc.

assets.quote: Practicing golf used to be a one-on-one experience. Cloud has enabled a virtual network where players can compete with each other from anywhere in the world.
assets.attribution:
Chris Jones
CEO, TruGolf, Inc.

assets.title:
George Dolbier
CTO, Social and Interactive Media, IBM
assets.copy: A computer scientist, George Dolbier has a long history of applying technologies to drive accelerated business growth in industries and sectors as diverse as consumer electronics and entertainment, retail, industrial, healthcare, B2B and IT.

title: music charts made with cloud
short-description: AudioMonitor is transforming music royalties with cloud

assets.copy: AudioMonitor is transforming music royalties with cloud
assets.capability: How to innovate a business model

assets.title: Summary
assets.copy:
It’s hard to determine what musicians are truly owed. AudioMonitor, an audience measurement system for radio, aims to solve that problem by analyzing real-time data from over 800 stations around Brazil.

Launched with IBM SoftLayer’s incubator program, their service generates reports on a user-friendly dashboard by tracking audience, location, schedules and song rotation, which helps media companies and artists determine how much they should be compensated. Once a startup, AudioMonitor now competes with the most established audience-measurement companies in the industry.
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about IBM Cloud - IaaS

assets.quote: There was no way to measure what was being played on the radio. Now we can monitor any artist, exactly where his songs are being played, at any moment.
assets.attribution:
Cesar Sponchiado,
CEO, AudioMonitor

assets.copy: The number of music plays AudioMonitor identifies per month.

assets.title: SoftLayer Catalyst Startup Incubator
assets.copy: By providing infrastructure and support, Softlayer Catalyst Startup incubator enables next generation technologies and empower entrepreneurs to realize their vision.

Jose Luis Spagnuolo
IBM Distinguished Engineer, CTO CAMS Brazil
assets.copy: José Luis Spagnuolo is CTO of Cloud, Analytics, Mobile and Social, and is an IBM Distinguished Engineer based in Brazil. He is responsible for developing solution strategies and offering technical advice to business leaders in multiple industries.

title: graduates made with data
short-description: Gwinnett County Public Schools is motivating students with data

assets.copy: Gwinnett County Public Schools is motivating students with data
assets.capability: How to innovate education

assets.title: Summary
assets.copy:
On average, 8,300 high school students drop out each day in the United States. Gwinnett County Public Schools, the 14th largest school district in the U.S., is pursuing an initiative in personalized education using IBM Analytics.

The project applies predictive modeling, deep-content analytics and advanced case management to identify how students learn and recommends personalized learning strategies. The eventual goal is to transform education by finding ways to motivate learners, and enhance teacher effectiveness using data.
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about Gwinnett County Public Schools

assets.quote: Analytics can help identify a student’s weaknesses and prescribe a personalized course of study.
assets.attribution:
Alvin Wilbanks,
CEO Superintendent, Gwinnett County Public Schools

assets.quote: We have been drowning in data, starving for meaningful information.
assets.attribution:
Alvin Wilbanks,
CEO Superintendent, Gwinnett County Public Schools

templates.template_desc: Get to know the people and the solutions behind the transformation.

assets.title:
Caroline A. Cassidy
IBM Client Executive for Gwinnett County Public Schools
assets.copy: With more than 18 years of experience in education, Caroline Cassidy has been a member of the State of Georgia team for the last 4 years. Caroline has an extensive background working with public sector accounts, which gives her a unique outlook on the challenges facing our schools.

assets.title: IBM Cognitive Computing
assets.copy: IBM Cognitive Computing represents a first step into cognitive systems by combining programmatic computing with natural language processing, hypothesis generation, evaluation, and dynamic learning.  With cognitive computing, organizations can have a deeper understanding of unstructured data to make more informed decisions.

assets.title: IBM Education Technology Solutions
assets.copy: By leveraging data expertise, deep analytics capabilities, and open standards, IBM Education Technology Solutions is creating new models for personalized education.

title: care made with IBM Watson
short-description: Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center is training IBM Watson to help doctors make better cancer treatment choices

assets.copy: Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center is training IBM Watson to help doctors make better cancer treatment choices
assets.capability: How to find big data insights

assets.title: Summary
assets.copy:
With thousands of permutations and millions of new cases every year, medical data on cancer is increasing exponentially. This creates a problem for doctors who want to offer tailored treatments based on data for their patients, but simply can’t process all the information on their own.

Enter IBM Watson™, a cognitive system that can process millions of pages of medical information per second and generate hypotheses. Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (MSKCC) is collaborating with IBM to train Watson in oncology, so that medical professionals everywhere can make better, faster and more informed decisions about how to treat each individual cancer patient.
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center

assets.quote: Watson gives a list of possible treatment options and then ranks its confidence that that answer is the best or correct one. That is exactly how a doctor thinks.
assets.attribution:
Dr. Mark Kris
Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center

assets.copy: pieces of medical evidence processed by IBM Watson
million pages from medical journals and clinical trials digested by IBM Watson

templates.template_desc: Get to know the people and the solutions behind the transformation.

assets.title: IBM Watson for Developers
assets.copy: With the Watson Developer Cloud, developers have the facility to integrate the Watson platform’s capabilities, as a service, through the use of API and tools. Organizations can now embed IBM Watson<sup>™</sup> cognitive capabilities within their applications without the need for building deep natural language or other core technology skills.

assets.title: IBM Watson
assets.copy: IBM Watson<sup>™</sup> represents a first step into cognitive systems by combining programmatic computing with natural language processing, hypothesis generation, evaluation, and dynamic learning.  With Watson, organizations can now have a deeper understanding of unstructured data to help make more informed decisions and find better answers by learning from both successes and failures.

assets.title: Watson in Healthcare
assets.copy: Watson in healthcare is using cognitive computing to enable a natural interaction between physicians, data and electronic medical records. Physicians can now use Watson to combine unstructured data with current findings from peer-reviewed research and clinical studies to help find answers. By substituting intuition with data and offering hypotheses based on analysis, Watson can help physicians transform healthcare.

assets.title:
Robert S. Merkel
Healthcare & Life Sciences Leader, IBM Watson Group
assets.copy: Rob Merkel has responsible for IBM’s portfolio of global transformational solutions enabled by Watson cognitive computing. He has over 23 years of experience on a wide range of consulting assignments related to all phases of business transformation.

title: authenticity made with data
short-description: Consorzio del Formaggio Parmigiano-Reggiano is detecting counterfeit cow’s milk with data

assets.copy: Consorzio del Formaggio Parmigiano-Reggiano is detecting counterfeit cow’s milk with data
assets.capability: How to combat fraud

assets.title: Summary
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about Consorzio del Formaggio Parmigiano-Reggiano
assets.copy:
Founded in 1934, Consorzio del Formaggio Parmigiano-Reggiano is a quality-control consortium designated to prevent fraud and off-label production of Parmesan cheese. Determining the authenticity of a cheese was once a complex process involving time-consuming manual spot checks in over 600 different dairies.

But now, using bar-code labeling and sensors with IBM Big Data & Analytics, the consortium can monitor daily production levels to help confirm the legitimacy of every round of Parmesan.

assets.quote: We've been fighting counterfeits since the 17th century... Analytics and data lets us do it much faster
assets.attribution:
Filippo Casaccio
Deputy General Manager, Consorzio del Formaggio Parmigiano-Reggiano

assets.copy: the amount of annual revenue a typical organization loses to fraud
the total amount of global losses due to fraud annually

title: power made with mobile
short-description: Bharat Light and Power is creating a greener India with mobile

assets.copy: Bharat Light and Power is creating a greener India with mobile
assets.capability: How to optimize a supply chain

assets.title: Summary
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about Bharat Light and Power
assets.copy:
Bharat Light and Power (BLP) is one of the largest clean energy companies in India, focusing on wind, solar, biomass and water for power generation. By working with Softlayer®, an IBM company, BLP built an infrastructure that helps them to better manage a vast fleet of wind farms scattered across the country.

Using mobile and social technology that connects them to citizens through the cloud, they are able to inform citizens about their power usage, determine energy demand and improve energy distribution through their wind farms.

assets.quote: In India we have 400 million people without electricity. We have the ability to produce enough—we're just not doing it well enough.
assets.attribution:
Tejpreet Singh Chopra
CEO, Bharat Light & Power

assets.quote: By capturing and analyzing data in real-time on the cloud we can extract untapped energy from wind farms.
assets.attribution:
Tejpreet Singh Chopra
CEO, Bharat Light & Power

title: prototypes made with cloud
short-description: HotelsCombined.com is creating a metasearch engine with cloud

assets.copy: HotelsCombined.com is creating a metasearch engine with cloud
assets.capability: How to innovate a business model

assets.title: Summary
assets.copy: HotelsCombined.com, an Australian start-up, is the world’s leading hotel price comparison search engine with 300 million annual customers. In order to provide the best user experience, they needed a flexible, scalable, low-maintenance data infrastructure that would allow them to test ideas and launch new features quickly, and with little risk. But they didn’t want vast infrastructure to distract them from what they do best: compile hotel price data and make it searchable. By working with SoftLayer, an IBM company, for pay-as-you-go cloud, they could scale up seamlessly as their business took off.
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about HotelsCombined.com

assets.quote: We needed the ability to push a button and scale instantly in order to be successful.
assets.attribution:
Brendon McQueen,
Co-founder, HotelsCombined.com

assets.copy: million users visit HotelsCombined.com
hotels in the HotelsCombined.com database
countries searchable through HotelsCombined.com
real-time international hotel deals

title: reinvention made with cloud
short-description: KYOCERA Document Solutions is managing customer relationships with cloud

assets.copy: KYOCERA Document Solutions is managing customer relationships with cloud.
assets.capability: How to innovate a business model

assets.title: Summary
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about IBM Cloud
assets.copy:
The proliferation of mobile and cloud has led to a huge demand for secure information sharing. This is why KYOCERA Document Solutions, a leader in sales and maintenance services for document management equipment, expanded its business into data management and security services.

With the help of IBM Cloud, KYOCERA Document Solution’s CRM system supports the management of customers, sales, forecasts and marketing information around the world. Today, thanks to the cloud, KYOCERA Document Solutions is as good at managing customer relationships as it is at managing documents.

assets.quote: Once the customer data was visualized, we realized that  America, Europe and China — who seemed to be saying different things — were actually saying the same thing.
assets.attribution:
Katsumi Komaguchi
President, KYOCERA Document Solutions

assets.copy: of leading organizations reported that they used cloud to innovate products and services rapidly
in the study who used cloud said they saw an increase in efficiency

assets.copy: IBM Cloud is a collection of enterprise-class technology-as-a-service to help customers develop cloud and mobile applications on a leading-edge platform. By using self-service infrastructure with instant deployment, it offers agility and innovative applications to business users.

assets.title:
Goichi Suzaki
VP, Kansai Region Enterprise, S&D, IBM Japan
assets.copy: Goichi Suzaki is Vice President, Kansai Region Enterprise, for IBM Japan. He has held several IBM executive positions including in the industrial sector and strategic alliances and in the former Personal Computing Division. He joined IBM in 1985.

title: miami made with social
short-description: Miami-Dade County is facilitating citizen participation with social

assets.copy: Miami-Dade County is facilitating citizen participation with social
assets.capability: How to empower a citizen

assets.title: Summary
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about Miami-Dade County
assets.copy:
Data creates transparency. Using IBM Cloud plus Big Data & Analytics, Miami-Dade County is reinventing the way municipal government works. Making data visible, accessible, and actionable can help the county to crack cold cases, reduce water waste and design better public transportation.

By giving residents insight into how their tax money is spent, the municipality is helping constituents play a role in local governance—a great example of citizen participation enabled by data, mobile and cloud.

assets.quote: With technology, everyone has a key to the city. You could say I have 2.5 million co-mayors
assets.attribution:
Carlos A. Giménez,
Mayor of Miami-Dade County

assets.quote: We used to hear from citizens every four years at the ballot box. Now we hear from them every day through their mobile devices.
assets.attribution:
Carlos A. Giménez,
Mayor of Miami-Dade County

assets.copy: expected reduction in water consumption
expected in savings due to operational efficiencies per year
residents in the county with access to key metrics and financial transparency
"hit rate" achieved by Miami-Dade Police Department in identifying suspects in 40 solved cases

title: advances made with IBM Watson
short-description: The New York Genome Center is personalizing brain cancer treatment with Watson

assets.copy: The New York Genome Center is personalizing brain cancer treatment with Watson
assets.capability: How to find Big Data insights

assets.title: Summary
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about the New York Genome Center
assets.copy:
Cancer is a genetic disease with two large hurdles in the way of treating it. First, some patients may need to try many different treatments before finding one that works, which wastes valuable time. Second, oncologists can’t keep up with the avalanche of medical data on cancer. But the New York Genome Center is using IBM Watson™ for Life Sciences to help overcome those obstacles.

Watson’s ability to read millions of pages of medical data in seconds has turned it into a powerful resource for information on cancer. Geneticists hope that running the DNA sequence of a brain cancer tumor through Watson will provide information that could help them quickly develop the best, personalized treatment for that patient.

assets.quote: A very intelligent machine like Watson will help us to see the needle in the haystack that’s driving a disease.
assets.attribution:
Dr. Robert Darnell
President & Scientific Director, The New York Genome Center

assets.copy: pieces of medical evidence processed by IBM Watson
pages from medical journals and clinical trials digested by IBM Watson

templates.template_desc: Get to know the people and the solutions behind the transformation.

assets.title: IBM Watson
assets.copy: IBM Watson<sup>TM</sup> represents a first step into cognitive systems by combining programmatic computing with natural language processing, hypothesis generation, evaluation, and dynamic learning.  With Watson, organizations can now have a deeper understanding of unstructured data to help make more informed decisions and find better answers by learning from both successes and failures.

assets.title: Watson in Healthcare
assets.copy: Watson in healthcare is using cognitive computing to enable a natural interaction between physicians, data and electronic medical records. Physicians can now use Watson to combine unstructured data with current findings from peer-reviewed research and clinical studies to help find answers. By substituting intuition with data and offering hypotheses based on analysis, Watson can help physicians transform healthcare.

assets.title:
Dr. Raminderpal Singh
Business Development Executive, Watson Genomic Analytics, IBM Research
assets.copy: Dr. Raminderpal Singh leads Genomic Analytics Business Development for IBM, which applies IBM Watson technology, cloud services and new business models in the healthcare and life sciences industries. He has extensive experience in the semiconductor industry and in venture capital.

title: road trips made with cloud
short-description: Green eMotion is paving the way for electric vehicles with cloud

assets.copy: Green eMotion is paving the way for electric vehicles with cloud
assets.capability: How to innovate a business model

assets.title: Summary
assets.copy:
To lower carbon emissions, the European Commission launched Green eMotion, a four-year initiative to promote the mass adoption of electric vehicles (EVs) across the continent. The project brings together 43 partners from various industries and sectors to build a single, continent-wide grid of charging stations that can support the daily use of millions of EVs by 2020.

IBM Cloud provided a single platform where all the partners can work together, starting from the idea development phase.
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about Green eMotion

assets.quote: The goal is seamless electrical driving across Europe.
assets.attribution:

title: eggs made with data
short-description: The British Columbia Egg Marketing Board is protecting public health with data

assets.copy: The British Columbia Egg Marketing Board is protecting public health with data
assets.capability: How to optimize a supply chain

assets.title: Summary
assets.copy:
The British Columbia Egg Marketing Board (BC Egg) oversees all egg production in British Columbia. Keeping track of millions of chickens and hundreds of millions of eggs is no easy feat, especially when it comes to controlling salmonella outbreaks. But by capturing egg production data electronically from on-site inspectors with tablets, they can now proactively help protect public health by better pinpointing the origin of tainted eggs.

IBM Big Data & Analytics can also provide insights into market trends, like spikes in demand around Easter and Christmas, so that BC Egg can increase or decrease production accordingly.
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about BC Egg

assets.quote: We see things in data that we didn’t see before.
assets.attribution:
Anne-Marie Butler
Director of Finance and Administration, BC Egg Marketing Board

assets.quote: If there is a disease outbreak, we can track those eggs back to the producers so we know whose they are.
assets.attribution:
Anne-Marie Butler
Director of Finance and Administration, BC Egg Marketing Board

assets.copy: reduction in farm inspection workload
reduction in time it takes to plan budgets and sourcing

templates.template_desc: Get to know the people and the solutions behind the transformation.

assets.title: IBM Big Data & Analytics - Operations
assets.copy: Big Data and analytics operations focus on analyzing machine data, which can include anything from IT machines to sensors, meters and GPS devices. By using big data for operations analysis, an organization can improve its operations by gaining real-time visibility into customer experience, transactions and behavior.

assets.title: IBM Cognos Business Intelligence
assets.copy: IBM Cognos® Business Intelligence provides reporting, analysis and dashboards to help key stakeholders understand business performance, collaborate, and make data-driven decisions.

title: insights made with IBM Watson
short-description: Nielsen is finding answers to complex questions with Watson

assets.copy: Nielsen is finding answers to complex questions with Watson
assets.capability: How to provide one-to-one services

assets.title: Summary
assets.copy:
Nielsen, the media measurement and market research firm, helps marketers to better understand their customers. But the media landscape has evolved. Now, besides measuring what people buy and watch, big data is also making it easier for clients to find answers to complex questions.

Working with IBM Watson, Nielsen is looking to integrate structured data with unstructured data, such as social conversations. Beyond providing a wealth of information, Watson is helping marketers to answer perennial questions like, "Is my marketing working?"
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about IBM Watson

assets.quote: IBM, with Watson, has a big commitment to the harvesting of unstructured data. At Nielsen, we collect more structured data than anybody else—and the combination of those two is really transformational.
assets.attribution:
Paul Donato
EVP & Chief Research Officer, Nielsen

assets.copy: Number of pages IBM Watson could read and understand in 3 seconds when it was on Jeopardy!
The estimated portion of the world’s data that is unstructured.

templates.template_desc: Get to know the people and the solutions behind the transformation.

assets.title: IBM Watson
assets.copy: IBM Watson<sup>TM</sup> represents a first step into cognitive systems by combining programmatic computing with natural language processing, hypothesis generation, evaluation, and dynamic learning.  With Watson, organizations can now have a deeper understanding of unstructured data to help make more informed decisions and find better answers by learning from both successes and failures.

assets.title: IBM Watson for Developers
assets.copy: With the Watson Developer Cloud, developers have the facility to integrate Watson platform capabilities, as a service, through the use of API and tools. Organizations can now embed IBM Watson<sup>TM</sup> cognitive capabilities within their applications without the need for building deep natural language or other core technology skills.

assets.title: Watson Engagement Advisor
assets.copy: In an age when customers demand more, IBM Watson<sup>TM</sup> Engagement Advisor can help show you what they want, understand natural language to provide your customers with possible answers and ultimately empowers them to take an action.

assets.title: IBM Power Systems
assets.copy: Built as an open platform for choice, Power Systems<sup>TM</sup> provides flexibility for organizations of all sizes to turn massive volumes of raw data into actionable business insights.

assets.title:
Stephen Gold
VP, Watson Ecosystem and Market Development, IBM Watson Group
assets.copy: A member of the senior leadership team, Stephen Gold is responsible for bringing Watson’s transformative capabilities to the global market via the Watson Developer Cloud, Watson Content Store and Watson Talent Hub.

title: fans made with mobile
short-description: Sun Life Stadium is delivering a winning audience experience with mobile

assets.copy: Sun Life Stadium is delivering a winning audience experience with mobile
assets.capability: How to provide one-to-one services

assets.title: Summary
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about Sun Life Stadium
assets.copy:
With more than 1.5 million square feet, over 24,000 parking spaces and 75,000 seats, Sun Life Stadium has countless moving parts. In the past, it relied on complex systems to manage everything from parking to concession sales and weather data. But now, after integrating their systems on IBM Cloud, Sun Life Stadium has a consolidated view of their operations.

Thanks to improved efficiency, along with the ability to connect with audience members via mobile phone, Sun Life Stadium can make everyone at the game feel like a winner.

assets.quote: We want to be able to tell you, what roads to take based upon where you live. Where to park based on where you’re sitting.
assets.attribution:
Tery Howard,
Chief Technology Officer, Sun Life Stadium

assets.quote: Before, fans spent time in long lines. And now they spend time watching the game.
assets.attribution:
Tery Howard,
Chief Technology Officer, Sun Life Stadium

assets.copy: increase in process efficiency within stadium operations

title: banks made with data
short-description: Banorte is creating personalized banking with data

assets.copy: Banorte is creating personalized banking with data
assets.capability: How to provide one-to-one services

assets.title: Summary
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about IBM Big Data & Analytics
assets.copy:
When Banorte had a smaller number of branches, they knew each of their clients personally. But as they grew and became one of the largest banks in Mexico, they lost the ability to understand their clients as individuals.

IBM Big Data & Analytics is allowing Banorte to gain insights into the banking behaviors of specific customers. They are redesigning their systems so that now, bank employees can access information about what products best suit the unique needs of each customer, creating an experience that feels personal again.

assets.quote: You will not be talking about market segments anymore. You will be talking about individuals.
assets.attribution:
Alejandro Valenzuela
CEO, Grupo Financiero Banorte

assets.quote: Big data is giving us the capacity to serve a client on an individual basis.
assets.attribution:
Alejandro Valenzuela
CEO, Grupo Financiero Banorte

assets.copy: in improved efficiencies across the banks
return on equity is expected due to the bank’s new customer-centric banking model

templates.template_desc: Get to know the people and the solutions behind the transformation.

assets.title:
Adrian Blanco
IBM Client Director for Banorte
assets.copy: Adrian Blanco has been the Client Director for Banorte since 2013. With 25 years of experience at IBM, Adrian has held positions in Sales and Services in Latin America. Previously he managed Global Technology Services for financial institutions in Spanish-speaking South America.

assets.title: IBM Big Data & Analytics — Marketing and Sales
assets.copy: IBM Business Analytics solutions for marketing can help organizations acquire, grow and retain customers by anticipating their desires and creating personalized experiences. By identifying customer attitudes, opinions and emerging trends, marketers can better develop effective marketing strategies for the future.

title: chocolate made with cloud
short-description: Lindt is personalizing the customer experience with cloud

assets.copy: Lindt is personalizing the customer experience with cloud
assets.capability: How to provide one-to-one services

assets.title: Summary
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about Lindt
assets.copy:
For Lindt, one of the oldest and most popular confectioners in the world, scale came along with a few challenges. Customers who bought chocolates online had a limited choice in the form of prepackaged assortments.

Now on IBM Cloud, Lindt’s e-commerce platform is putting customers back in control, enabling them to create unique assortments, mix and match their favorite products, and design custom packaging based on their individual tastes. Satisfied customers are leading to greater loyalty and better sales.

assets.quote: Chocolate is a very personal experience. Lindt needed a scalable solution which would allow us to individualize our offerings and our interactions with consumers.
assets.attribution:
Thomas Linemayr
CEO and President, Lindt & Sprüngli (USA) Inc.

assets.quote: If we learn somebody’s a white chocolate lover, we don’t offer them dark chocolate. Or vice versa.
assets.attribution:
Thomas Linemayr
CEO and President, Lindt & Sprüngli (USA) Inc.

assets.copy: growth in mobile sales over the 2013 holiday season
increase in Black Friday conversions
over previous Cyber Monday sales record with the new eCommerce Platform

title: collaboration made with social
short-description: Princess Cruises is optimizing their operations with social

assets.copy: Princess Cruises is optimizing their operations with social
assets.capability: How to empower a workforce

assets.title: Summary
assets.copy:
On average, Princess Cruises has 1.7 million passengers and 30,000 employees sailing around the world every year. The organization needed an integrated global communications system that connected all of their assets. Now with IBM® Cloud, messaging, calendar and IM services have transformed 17 ships — spread across five oceans — into a single fleet.

Sudden weather delays and coordinating the movement of thousands of passengers are now facilitated in real time with social, which can help transform the customer experience and ultimately increase loyalty.
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about Princess Cruises

assets.quote: Collaboration tools come in to play when curve balls are thrown our way — a deviation from the ship’s schedule or a weather delay, for example.
assets.attribution:
Norm Ayers
Director of Emergency Response, Princess Cruises

assets.quote: Employees who may have in the past felt like they were largely unheard can now contribute and communicate.
assets.attribution:
Norm Ayers
Director of Emergency Response, Princess Cruises

assets.copy: Passengers sailing with Princess in a year.
Number of employees at Princess Cruises
Employees sailing at any time
Ships (each with the resource requirements of a small town)

assets.copy: IBM has integrated tools for social business in the cloud by connecting individuals in efficient ways, providing line of sight across traditional boundaries and aligning actions to help anticipate and address evolving opportunities. By unlocking and facilitating the sharing of information that was previously siloed, organizations can empower each and every employee with social business.

assets.title: IBM Cloud - SaaS
assets.copy: IBM Cloud offers over 100 software-as-a-service applications to help organizations accelerate business process innovation, deliver business analytics at point of impact and connect people with collaborative business networks.

assets.title: Mark Harper IBM SmartCloud Technical Leader
assets.copy: Mark Harper has over 20 years of experience in messaging and collaboration system implementation and administration, focusing on Lotus Notes/Domino, cloud computing and social business. He spent 10 years in Software Services for Lotus before moving to Sales and Distribution in 2007.

title: discoveries made with data
short-description: ASTRON is investigating the universe with data

assets.copy: ASTRON is investigating the universe with data
assets.capability: How to optimize Big Data insights

assets.title: Summary
assets.copy:
ASTRON is a global community of astronomers, setting out to build the Square Kilometre Array (SKA), the world’s largest radio telescope. It’s predicted that this project will generate twice the total amount of data created by the entirety of the internet daily. In other words, it will present the biggest big data challenge ever.

IBM is working to develop a supercomputing solution that can process this massive amount of data. This information could help scientists demystify the big bang and understand how our universe was formed.
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about ASTRON

assets.quote: With Big Data, we will be able to investigate the earliest phases of the universe, to actually detect the first stars and galaxies being formed, and make detailed maps of the universe.
assets.attribution:
Albert-Jan Boonstra
Head of R&D, ASTRON

assets.quote: If there’s someone else out there transmitting on nearby planets, then we’ll hear ‘em.
assets.attribution:
Albert-Jan Boonstra
Head of R&D, ASTRON

assets.copy: the daily internet traffic is the amount of raw data captured daily by the SKA

assets.title: IBM Big Data & Analytics- IT
assets.copy: The IBM Big Data & Analytics infrastructure helps organizations overcome the challenges of dealing with growing amounts of data. This platform which can be implemented on-premises or on the cloud, lets customers store, govern, manage and analyze data while reducing IT complexity.

assets.title: IBM Platform Computing
assets.copy: IBM Platform Computing provides a complete set of easy-to-deploy, technical and high-performance computing (HPC) capabilities in a single product. It can help users to reduce the complexity of managing their high-performance computing environment and to improve their time to results, while reducing costs.

assets.title: Dr. Ton Engbersen, Scientific Director ASTRON & IBM Center for Exascale Technology
assets.copy: Ton Engbersen is the Scientific Director of the ASTRON & IBM Center for Exascale Technology in conjunction with the DOME project. An IBMer since 1980, his background includes image processing, chip design, communications technology, server technology, and legacy management.

title: zoos made with data
short-description: Point Defiance Zoo & Aquarium is predicting visitor behaviors with data

assets.copy: Point Defiance Zoo & Aquarium is predicting visitor behaviors with data
assets.capability: How to optimize an operation

assets.title: Summary
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about Point Defiance Zoo & Aquarium
assets.copy:
Before Point Defiance Zoo & Aquarium became data driven, they determined how many employees to hire and how many supplies to purchase, simply by guessing the number of visitors they’d have on a given day.

But IBM Big Data & Analytics has improved those estimations by correlating data from various sources, like mobile check-ins and weather reports. With insights drawn from data, they can now better anticipate the needs of their visitors and make more effective business decisions.

assets.quote: Analytics could potentially transform the way we manage almost every aspect of our operations.
assets.attribution:
Donna Powell,
Business Manager, Point Defiance Zoo & Aquarium

assets.copy: growth in Point Defiance Zoo’s online ticket sales over the past year with the help of Big Data & Analytics
reduced annual labor costs through more proactive, data driven planning
annual member acquisition rate (tripled from 3%) thanks to the rapid creation and execution of targeted marketing campaigns

title: music made with cloud
short-description: Music Mastermind is turning phones into music studios with cloud

assets.copy: Music Mastermind is turning phones into music studios with cloud
assets.capability: How to innovate a business model

assets.title: Summary
assets.copy:
Music Mastermind developed a first-of-its-kind mobile game that allows fans to compose and share original songs created, in part, from a library of prelicensed samples. They needed robust, globally dispersed infrastructure for their active users, hosting and application development.

With the help of SoftLayer®, an IBM company, Music Mastermind created a cloud-based solution that provides a gaming experience to over 250,000 active users in 155 countries. And that is music to everybody’s ears.
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about Music Mastermind

assets.quote: Users can now enjoy music creation wherever they are.

Matt Serletic,
Co-Founder & CEO, Music Mastermind

Matt Serletic,
Co-Founder & CEO, Music Mastermind

assets.copy: of the $10 billion revenue generated last year by mobile applications came from gaming

title: tv lovers made with data
short-description: Sky Italia is customizing must-see TV with data

assets.copy: Sky Italia is customizing must-see TV with data
assets.capability: How to provide one-to-one services

assets.title: Summary
assets.copy:
Satellite TV provider Sky Italia used to rely on data from cable boxes to understand what their customers were watching. But after switching to digital platforms, they were able to find new insights into viewing behaviors with IBM Big Data & Analytics.

Working with IBM, they created program schedules and on-demand content based on social media data that revealed which shows their customers were talking about. The same data also allowed them to run targeted marketing campaigns, delivering more effective messaging to precise customer segments.
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about Sky Italia

assets.quote: We used to know little about our subscribers except maybe where they lived and what TV package they had. Now we know what they love to watch.
assets.attribution:
Umberto Angelucci
CTO, Sky Italia

assets.quote: With data analytics, we can give subscribers more of what they love.
assets.attribution:
Umberto Angelucci
CTO, Sky Italia

title: recipes made with IBM Watson
short-description: IBM is innovating in the kitchen with Watson

assets.copy: IBM is innovating in the kitchen with Watson
assets.capability: How to innovate with IBM Research

assets.title: Summary
assets.copy:
Can a machine be creative? IBM Watson’s cognitive cooking system, the result of a collaboration with professional chefs at the Institute of Culinary Education (ICE) in New York has some finger-licking answers.

Using a set of algorithms that draw upon a number of datasets such as ingredient compositions, cultural knowledge and food-pairing theories, the team has come up with several delicious dishes. The leap from making inferences about the world to making new discoveries, is the next step in cognitive computing.
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about Cognitive Cooking

assets.quote: The system doesn't look at ingredients like chefs do, it looks at the chemical composition of the ingredients.
assets.attribution: Florian Pinel</br>Chef, Scientist and Lead Architect of the Cognitive Cooking project

assets.copy: ingredients parsed
recipes with 200,000 ingredients dissected
flavor compounds analyzed
ingredient pairings examined by the IBM cognitive computer

With cognitive computing, organizations can have a deeper understanding of unstructured data to make more informed decisions.

title: new customers made with data
short-description: Leyou is understanding the needs of its customers with data

assets.copy: Leyou is understanding the needs of its customers with data
assets.capability: How to provide one-to-one services

assets.title: Summary
assets.copy:
As it grew from a traditional chain store to include online and direct marketing, Leyou, a retailer with products for moms, babies and kids, knew that intuition was not enough to sustain growth.

By integrating analytics at the core of the business, IBM helps Leyou identify the what, when and where behind the millions of transactions made by its members. With 4 million online customers and stores in 13 cities, Leyou has found analytics to play a key role in helping the company understand the needs of a growing Chinese middle-class and in cementing its place among the country’s largest retailers.
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about Smarter Commerce for Retail

assets.quote: We are waking up to the massive potential of the data we have as a membership-based retailer.
assets.attribution: Larry Kung</br>COO and Co-founder, Leyou

assets.copy: of retailers reported in a recent study that big data and analytics are creating a competitive advantage for their organizations

title: trade made with cloud
short-description: The city of Ningbo is modernizing logistics in one of the world’s busiest ports with cloud

assets.copy: The city of Ningbo is modernizing logistics in one of the world’s busiest ports with cloud
assets.capability: How to optimize a supply chain

assets.cta_copy: Learn more about IBM Cloud
assets.title: Summary
assets.copy:
The ancient city of Ningbo, home to one of the busiest ports in the world, needed to update its antiquated and inefficient logistical systems. Working with IBM, the city is developing the Smart Logistics Center to streamline the port’s entire supply chain and allow the 5,000 logistics companies in Ningbo to share data.

Now every shipping vehicle has a GPS tracker, the idling of trucks has decreased and the circulation of goods has accelerated. Through this platform, Ningbo is setting a precedent for the rest of China.

assets.quote: We want to build a smarter platform that brings the shipper and receiver closer, and where everything’s visible.
assets.attribution:
Larry Qin
CEO of Ningbo Smarter Logistics

assets.quote: The logistics industry can no longer rely on verbal communication and incomplete information.
assets.attribution:
Larry Qin
CEO of Ningbo Smarter Logistics

assets.copy: reduced idle time of one customer’s trucks
saved annually by the same customer

templates.template_desc: Get to know the people and the solutions behind the transformation.

assets.title: IBM Cloud Consulting
assets.copy: Based on in-depth analysis of your business goals and requirements, IBM cloud consulting can help you develop and execute a customized strategy to drive growth, savings and revenue and help you transform your business model.

assets.title: IBM Social Business - Social Collaboration
assets.copy: IBM has the tools and expertise to help you maximize the value of social collaboration in business environments, delivered on premises or in the cloud. By unlocking and facilitating the sharing of information that was previously siloed, organizations can empower each and every employee with social collaboration.

title: nanostorage made with atoms
short-description: IBM is transforming computing with nanotechnology

assets.copy: IBM is transforming computing with nanotechnology
assets.capability: How to innovate with IBM Research

assets.title: Summary
assets.copy:
The ability to move single atoms, the building blocks of all matter in the universe, is crucial to advancing nanostorage. In 2012, IBM announced the creation of the world's smallest magnetic memory bit, made of just 12 atoms. This breakthrough can transform computing by facilitating the development of devices that have access to unprecedented levels of data storage.

But even nanophysicists like to have a little fun. In that spirit, the scientists moved atoms by using their scanning tunneling microscope to make a movie, which has been verified by Guinness World Records™ as the world’s Smallest Stop-Motion Film.
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about A Boy & His Atom

assets.quote: We can't know what future technologies will be, but we can lay the groundwork and spur our imaginations and get a head start in exploring these new worlds
assets.attribution:
Christopher Lutz,
Scientist at IBM Research

assets.quote: If commercialized, one day this atomic memory could store all of the movies ever made, in a device the size of a fingernail.
assets.attribution:
Andreas Heinrich,
Principal Investigator, IBM Research

assets.copy: of today’s hard drives would hold the same amount of data as IBM’s Atomic Scale hard drives

templates.template_desc: Get to know the people and the solutions behind the transformation.

assets.title: IBM Research
assets.copy: IBM Research is a global community of forward-thinkers working to push the boundaries of science, technology and business to make the world work better. Scientists at IBM Research have developed the Watson™ Cognitive Computer and Atomic-Scale-Memory, innovations that have already made an impact on real-world applications.

assets.title: Atomic Scale Magnetic Memory
assets.copy: With atomic-scale magnetic memory, soon computers will be able to store one bit of data in 12 atoms. By studying the behavior of atoms, scientists at IBM Research are identifying crucial factors for building smaller, faster and more energy-efficient devices.

assets.title:
Andreas Heinrich
Principal Investigator, IBM Research
assets.copy: Andreas Heinrich leads a research team focused on exploring atomic-scale structures for possible applications in computation and data-storage. He also educates the public on nanoscience, as demonstrated by the 2013 movie A Boy And His Atom

title: teaching made with data
short-description: Toshiba is making the planet smarter with data

assets.copy: Toshiba is making the planet smarter with data
assets.capability: How to optimize an operation

assets.title: Summary
assets.cta_copy: Learn more about IBM Big Data & Analytics
assets.copy:
Toshiba, a multinational engineering and electronics conglomerate, is working with IBM's R&D to transform its business model. From a manufacturer of electronics, using cloud and data, they have evolved into a provider of added value to their products.

By employing usage data in the cloud to reduce wasteful processor idling, decrease energy consumption, lower emissions, and extend the longevity of the devices, Toshiba can continue to work to improve the performance of their products even after they have been sold. Another example of how data is making the planet smarter.

assets.quote: We used to fix the devices when they broke. But now they can warn us before they do.
assets.attribution:
Taro Hiyama
Chief Marketing Executive, Toshiba

assets.quote: Teachers should not have to worry about technology. They should just focus on teaching.
assets.attribution:
Taro Hiyama
Chief Marketing Executive, Toshiba

templates.template_desc: Get to know the people and the solutions behind the transformation.

assets.title: IBM MobileFirst
assets.copy: IBM MobileFirst offers end-to-end mobile solutions by integrating service offerings, platform development, security and mobile device management in a connected world.

assets.title: IBM MessageSight
assets.copy: IBM MessageSight is a full-featured messaging appliance designed for machine-to-machine and mobile environments. By processing a large volume of events in near real time, it can deliver messaging for the edge of the enterprise to reach out to the Internet of Things.

assets.title:
Hiroaki Hasegawa
Senior Client Representative, Toshiba Enterprise, Industry Sales, IBM Japan
assets.copy: Hiroaki Hasegawa is an IBM Senior Client Representative for the Toshiba group, leading strategic corporate alliance projects such as Toshiba's Smart Community & Cloud and Healthcare businesses.
